poem:
**Not on GamStop**

He came in through football,  
a scarf of hope round his throat—  
fifteen grand, sign-up confetti,  
then the long season of loss.

Offshore screens, bright as fruit machines,  
found him even after *stop*.  
"Not on GamStop," they whispered—  
nets with no keeper.

Kind lad, endlessly.  
Till odds re-wrote him:  
better off dead.
